com.adeptions.clarguments.arguments

Class AbstractArgument<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.adeptions.clarguments.arguments.AbstractArgument<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of the argument value
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Argument<T>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BooleanArgument, DoubleArgument, FileArgument, FlagArgument, InformationalArgument, IntegerArgument, StringArgument

    public abstract class AbstractArgument<T>
extends java.lang.Object
implements Argument<T>
    This class provides a skeletal implementation of Argument with default basic implementations of common methods. Extend this class to create entirely new typed arguments (or simply extend/override behaviour of existing concrete classes (e.g. BooleanArgument, DoubleArgument, FlagArgument, InformationalArgument, IntegerArgument or StringArgument) This class specifically does NOT implement the setRawValue() method - which must be implemented in concrete classes.

      Denotes that the argument was specified (found) during parsing (without having to set an actual value - in the case of flag or informational type arguments)
      boolean wasSeen()
      Whether the argument was seen (even if it was invalid) during parsing (This flag is maintained so that multiple argument checkers can check if the argument was encountered at all - even if the value was invalid)

      • getValue

        public T getValue()
        Gets the value found for the argument If the argument was not specified, this method should return the argument definition default value (if specified) or simply return null. If the argument was found multiple times, this method should return the first value found
